text: Andrew Jay Schneider (November 13, 1942 â€“ February 17, 2017) was an American journalist and investigative reporter. He worked for the Pittsburgh Press and Seattle Post-Intelligencer as a public-health reporter. He was born in The Bronx, New York. He received two Pulitzer Prizes while working for the Press: one for Specialized Reporting in 1986 with Mary Pat Flaherty and another for Public Service with Matthew Brelis and the Press. Schneider died in Salt Lake City, Utah from heart failure on February 17, 2017, aged 74. ==References== Category:Pulitzer Prize winners Category:1942 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American journalists Category:Writers from New York City
